<denchmark-h:h2>Bug Description</denchmark-h>
Trying to run "python setup.py install" fails with a unicode error when reading README.md. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
docker run --gpus=all -it nvcr.io/nvidia/tensorrt:20.03-py3 /bin/bash (cd /usr/bin && wget -O bazel https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazelisk/releases/download/v1.7.3/bazelisk-linux-amd64 && chmod +x bazel) git clone https://github.com/NVIDIA/TRTorch.git cd TRTorch/py pip install -r requirements.txt python setup.py install
The error follows:
root@320583666d0c:/workspace/TRTorch/py# python setup.py install Traceback (most recent call last): File "setup.py", line 194, in long_description = fh.read() File "/usr/lib/python3.6/encodings/ascii.py", line 26, in decode return codecs.ascii_decode(input, self.errors)[0] UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe2 in position 7349: ordinal not in range(128)
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
No unicode error <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.6.0 CPU Architecture: x86 OS (e.g., Linux): Linux How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, libtorch, source): pip Build command you used (if compiling from source): python setup.py install Are you using local sources or building from archives: local sources (git clone) Python version: 3.6.9 CUDA version: 10.2.89 GPU models and configuration: gtx 970
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
The following appears to resolve the issue: <denchmark-code>diff --git a/py/setup.py b/py/setup.py index 53f85da..8344c0a 100644 --- a/py/setup.py +++ b/py/setup.py @@ -190,7 +190,7 @@ ext_modules = [ ) ]
-with open("README.md", "r") as fh: +with open("README.md", "r", encoding="utf-8") as fh: long_description = fh.read()
setup( </denchmark-code>
